definitions.definition: To hang in equilibrium ; to be balanced or suspended; hence, to be in suspense or doubt.
To be of a given weight ; to weigh .
To add weight to, to weigh down .
To hold (something) with or against something else in equilibrium ; to balance , counterpose .
To hold (something) in equilibrium , to hold balanced and ready ; to carry (something) ready to be used.
examples: I poised the crowbar in my hand, and waited.
to poise the scales of a balance

definitions.definition: To keep (something) in equilibrium ; to hold suspended or balanced.
examples: The rock was poised precariously on the edge of the cliff.

definitions.definition: To ascertain , as if by balancing; to weigh .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To hang in equilibrium ; to be balanced or suspended; hence, to be in suspense or doubt.
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) To be of a given weight ; to weigh . [14th–17th c.]
( obsolete ) To add weight to, to weigh down . [16th–18th c.]
( now rare ) To hold (something) with or against something else in equilibrium ; to balance , counterpose . [from 16th c.]
To hold (something) in equilibrium , to hold balanced and ready ; to carry (something) ready to be used. [from 16th c.]
To keep (something) in equilibrium ; to hold suspended or balanced. [from 17th c.]
To ascertain , as if by balancing; to weigh .
